title: UK Airport Car Parks Asks Customers Should Alcohol Be Banned On Flights
text:
A UK Car Parking company that helps people save money by comparing all the prices available at UK Airport car parks, is asking their customers should alcohol be banned on flights.
Over the past 12 months there has been a large number of incidents on board aircrafts leaving and flying to the UK. The majority of these incidents have been blamed on passengers being drunk and now, a leading airport parking company is asking should airports and airlines stop selling alcohol.
A lot of aviation experts believe more action needs to be taken over the alcohol problem with some saying that airports should not stop selling airlines before a serious accident happens. Some captains have also said that airlines should stop selling alcohol or limit the sale of one per passengers, but many believe this will never happen.
UK Airport Car Parks are now asking their customers on their blog http://www.ukairportcarparks.co.uk/blog/should-alcohol-be-banned-at-uk-airports and on their Facebook page https://www.facebook.com/ukacp if they feel Alcohol should be banned on airlines and at the airport.
According to the current response, many believe that alcohol should be banned to remove the problems caused by people being drunk on board an aircraft. Some people believe if the problem is not tackled then it could result in a serious incident involving an aircraft that could cost lives.
The airport car-parking expert is asking people to come forward and give their views on if alcohol should be banned.
To take part in the discussion, please visit their Facebook page https://www.facebook.com/ukacp or their blog http://www.ukairportcarparks.co.uk/blog/should-alcohol-be-banned-at-uk-airports
